I honestly don't understand why everybody is talking about {{champion:113}} not being played like a leader anymore?

Because nearby Meele champs can apply the E Passive without her needing to apply a stack first?
Well it's still not a good idea to let a {{champion:91}} for example hop in first to gain stacks.

The _"Allied Autos can gain stacks too mechanic"_ is supposed to help her gain stacks during the fight, but she still is supposed to do the engage herself.

Her passive slow immunity and huge Armor and MR boost is just as great to engage as her Ult(while power got cut off her Ult it's still a 1 target stun and a huge AoE slow field with big Range).

Once actually engaging other Champions will follow her into the fight and gain stacks for her that she can use with her E.

But when you think that she can get away by just sitting back and waiting for her Allies to gain her E stacks, trust me, that won't work.
Most other Meele champs are either squishy (Assassins) ,not mobile enough to start a fight themself (Juggernauts) and/or simply have too low Attack Speed to gain stacks quickly on top of probably being cc'ed anyway.

So her playstyle won't change.

She will still usually engage with her Ult and follow with her Q while her passive, that is great for engaging into the whole enemy team, can absorb a lot of Damage and Slows. After having engaged her team is supposed to follow her and gain stacks for her which she can use her E on.

that totally hits the Leader thematic.
only with a team to follow her she can get the full use out of her E.

**TL;DR**

The "sit back and wait for your team to gain stacks" playstlyle sounds OP in theory, but won't work in practice.
She will still have her Leader playstyle.
